item.title: Int Help
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(ServerCP.Owner)) { sendMessage("used: "+useWithnpc+" with: "+NPCIDitem+""); println("used: "+useWithnpc+" with: "+NPCIDitem+""); }else { println(playerName+" used: "+useWithnpc+" with: "+NPCIDitem); } break;

and

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(ServerCP.Owner)) { sendMessage("used: "+useWithfloor+" with: "+floorID+""); println("used: "+useWithfloor+" with: "+floorID+""); }else { println(playerName+" used: "+useWithfloor+" with: "+floorID); } break;

isn’t working.

Read full topic

item.title: Int Help
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“quest rs, post:18, topic:298275”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=394679.msg2933422#msg2933422 date=1251411996]

public int NPCIDitem = 0;

^^ Would be giving it a default value.
[/quote]

That’s correct. I havent been into servers lately and his declaration was inside the case

int NPCIDitem = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType;

wasn’t sure if it was going to affect the rest of his code

so try what jordie said:

int NPCIDitem = 0; // here it is declared and initialized a value

and the line after that should be:

NPCIDitem = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType; // here it is assigning the value you wanted originally.

Or just replace that whole thing with:

public int NPCIDitem = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType;

Read full topic

[/quote]

Well, it isnt giving me an error.[/quote]

unless you want your npcid to be 0 permanently and you know it is not supposed to be changing, then stick to his code, otherwise add the second line.

item.title: Int Help
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

[quote=“quest rs, post:12, topic:298275”]You’ve declared it but you’ve never given it an initial value. The computer knows there is X variable, and it is being stored somewhere but when the program gets to assigning x to something, it might not have any information about X’s value to assign to something. So give it a default value?

I’m guessing server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType is your X in my example :z because it is the value being assigned to NPCID[/quote]

thats a really great way to put it, I just don’t know what to do =/

Read full topic

item.title: Int Help
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

You’ve declared it but you’ve never given it an initial value. The computer knows there is X variable, and it is being stored somewhere but when the program gets to assigning x to something, it might not have any information about X’s value to assign to something. So give it a default value?

I’m guessing server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType is your X in my example :z because it is the value being assigned to NPCID

Read full topic

item.title: Int Help
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

case 57: // Use item on npc int usedWithSlotnpc = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); int itemUsedSlotnpc = inStream.readUnsignedWordA(); int useWithnpc = playerItems[usedWithSlotnpc]-1; int itemUsednpc = playerItems[itemUsedSlotnpc]-1; int NPCIDitem = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType; if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(ServerCP.Owner)) { sendMessage("used: "+useWithnpc+" with: "+NPCIDitem+""); println("used: "+useWithnpc+" with: "+NPCIDitem+""); }else { println(playerName+" used: "+useWithnpc+" with: "+NPCIDitem); } break;

I get this error:

variable NPCIDitem may not have been initialized in server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSLOT].npcType;

Do I have to change something or add NPCIDitem into the npchandler? I’m confused.

Read full topic
